column4: Hi folks - just trying to get to grips with the linux terminal. Trying to open all php files in VIM that have text 'split(' inside them. Tried "grep -rsl 'split(' | grep .php | vim", but I get a "Vim: warning: input is not from a terminal" error. Any ideas?
That's not quite the right way to do it
Something like vim `grep .....`      and get the grep set up to just give the filenames
